generif.text: RAI3 is a cell growth-promoting gene and a novel P53 transcriptional target
This evidence explains one of the mechanisms of the GPRC5A-regulated cell growth in some cancer cell lines.
Gprc5a functions as a tumor suppressor in mouse lung, and human GPRC5A may share this property.
Mechanisms underlying the induction of the putative human tumor suppressor GPRC5A are reported.
analysis of RAI3 expression in normal and cancerous human breast tissue at both the mRNA and protein levels
Loss of GPRC5A is associated with lung adenocarcinomas.
Decreased GPRC5A expression is associated with non-small cell lung cancers and lung inflammation.
RAI3 may contribute to the malignant progression of hepatocellular carcinoma
Data indicate that in mammary tumors, the mRNA expression of GPRC5A significantly correlated with that of BRCA1.
The interaction of miR-103a-3p with each of the two 5' UTR targets reduces the expression levels of both GPRC5A mRNA and GPRC5A protein in one normal epithelial and two pancreatic cancer cell lines.
EGFR interacted with GPRC5A and phosphorylated it in two conserved double-tyrosine motifs, Y317/Y320 and Y347/ Y350, at the C-terminal tail of GPRC5A.
Results show how GPRC5A deficiency leads to dysregulated EGFR and STAT3 signaling and lung tumorigenesis.
elevated levels of GPRC5A played significant roles in gastric cancer progression
under-expressed GPRC5A during lung tumorigenesis enhances any transcriptional stimulation through an active translational status.
Mutations of ARID1A, GPRC5A and MLL2 grant bladder cancer non-stem cells the capability of self-renewal.
GPRC5A is a potential oncogene in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma cells that is upregulated by gemcitabine with help from HuR.
our results implicate GPRC5A as a tumor suppressor in breast cancer cells, and GPRC5A exerts its tumor-suppressive function by inhibiting EGFR and its downstream pathway

findings reveal an unprecedented role for GPRC5A in regulation of the ITGB1-mediated cell adhesion and it's downstream signaling, thus indicating a potential novel role for GPRC5A in human epithelial cancers.
Suppression of GPRC5a results in decreased cell growth, proliferation and migration in pancreatic cancer cell lines via a STAT3 modulated pathway, independent from ERK activation
Data show that G protein-coupled receptor, family C, group 5, member A protein (GPRC5A) regulates oxidative stress through vanin 1 protein (VNN1).
Study underscores genomic alterations that represent early events in the development of Kras mutant LUAD following Gprc5a loss and tobacco carcinogen exposure.
p53 overexpression and GPRC5A induction markedly inhibited tumor cell viability and induced apoptosis.
These results suggest RAI3 plays an important role in adipogenesis of hASCs and may have a potential use in the future application.
miR-204 inhibits cell proliferation in gastric cancer by targeting CKS1B, CXCL1 and GPRC5A.

On the basis of our findings in human DN and in Gprc5a deficient mice, we believe that chronic reduction in Gprc5a expression plays a pathogenic role in the progression of DN. Results in cell culture support our other findings in mice showing that Gprc5a modulates EGFR and TGF-b signaling in podocytes.
GPRC5a was upregulated in pancreatic cancer (PaCa) leading to an enhanced drug resistance in PaCa cells.
RAI3 overexpression is associated with poor prognosis in esophageal cancers
The lung tumor suppressor gene GPRC5A played a protective role in cigarette smoke-induced lung tumor initiation.

Our findings demonstrated that miR342 regulates the cell proliferation of glioma by targeting GPRC5A, which indicates that miR342 is a target of interest regarding the treatment of refractory glioma, and it may provide a promising prognostic and therapeutic strategy for glioma treatment.

RNA-seq revealed that GPRC5A KO PC3 cells had dysregulated expression of cell cycle-related genes, leading to cell cycle arrest at the G2/M phase. Furthermore, the registered gene expression profile data set showed that the expression level of GPRC5A in original lesions of prostate cancer patients with bone metastasis was higher than that without bone metastasis.
RAI3 knockdown enhances osteogenic differentiation of bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells via STAT3 signaling pathway.
Adaptive RSK-EphA2-GPRC5A signaling switch triggers chemotherapy resistance in ovarian cancer.

Identification of Sca-1(+)Abcg1(+) bronchioalveolar epithelial cells as the origin of lung adenocarcinoma in Gprc5a-knockout mouse model through the interaction between lung progenitor AT2 and Lgr5 cells.
GPRC5a suppresses the proliferation of non-small cell lung cancer under wild type p53 background.
RhoA/C inhibits proliferation by inducing the synthesis of GPRC5A.
GPRC5A reduction contributes to pollutant benzo[a]pyrene injury via aggravating murine fibrosis, leading to poor prognosis of IIP patients.
Prognostic and clinicopathological significance of GPRC5A in various cancers: A systematic review and meta-analysis.
Knockdown of GPRC5A inhibits cell proliferation, migration and invasion in osteosarcoma.
RAI3 expression is not associated with clinical outcomes of patients with non-small cell lung cancer.
The G protein-coupled receptor GPRC5A-a phorbol ester and retinoic acid-induced orphan receptor with roles in cancer, inflammation, and immunity.
Influence of GPRC5A-Regulated ABCB1 Expression on Lung Adenocarcinoma Proliferation.
Deciphering the molecular regulatory of RAB32/GPRC5A axis in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
[Inhibitory effect of downregulating G protein-coupled receptor class C group 5 member A expression on lipopolysaccharide-induced inflammatory response in human gingival fibroblasts].
GPRC5A promotes paclitaxel resistance and glucose content in NSCLC.

BP.term: negative regulation of epidermal growth factor-activated receptor activity

name: G protein-coupled receptor class C group 5 member A
other_names: G-protein coupled receptor family C group 5 member A

wikipathways.name: GPCRs, Class C Metabotropic glutamate, pheromone

summary: This gene encodes a member of the type 3 G protein-coupling receptor family, characterized by the signature 7-transmembrane domain motif. The encoded protein may be involved in interaction between retinoid acid and G protein signalling pathways. Retinoic acid plays a critical role in development, cellular growth, and differentiation. This gene may play a role in embryonic development and epithelial cell differentiation. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
